name: rcasey-website-2025
title: Rcasey website 2025
description: A revamped version of my personal portfolio website.

name: subject-to-change
title: Subject to change
description: A management sim that blends wrestling promotion strategy with the loop and depth of football/championship manager titles. Build your roster, book compelling shows, balance egos and budgets, and grow your brand year after year.

name: Encompass-Work-Tracker
title: Encompass Work Tracker
description: A modular, multi-window desktop application built in C# using WPF (.xaml) to securely track client cases and contact attempts. Designed as a GDPR-compliant internal tool for charities and care teams, it replaces the need for third-party platforms like Airtable by keeping sensitive data local and structured.

name: Poker-Matic-5000
title: Poker Matic 5000
description: PokerMatic5000 is a C# console application created as part of a technical interview test for Switch Studios, a company specialising in gambling machine development. The goal was to implement a poker hand evaluator that accepts user input (a hand of five cards) and determines the hand ranking (e.g., Pair, Straight, Flush).

name: First-Person-Grap
title: First Person Grap
description: This is a personal prototype project exploring the idea of a wrestling-themed game, with an initial focus on simulating the physical structure of a wrestling ring using Unity.  While the gameplay is not developed and the simulation is currently non-functional, this project served as a sandbox to experiment with.

name: Codewars-Practice-C-Sharp
title: Codewars Practice C Sharp
description: This repository contains a small collection of my early attempts at solving Codewars challenges using C#. While short-lived, this repo represents my early interest in sharpening core algorithm and syntax skills outside of my usual game dev work.

name: Testing-Code
title: Testing Code
description: This project contains some of my very first experiments with coding — created right after writing my initial "Hello World" program. These small wins may seem basic now, but they were a huge step at the time and mark the real start of my journey into software and game development.

name: Coding-Practice
title: Coding Practice
description: This repository contains a collection of basic C++ programs written during the first few weeks of my BSc Games Development degree at the University of Suffolk. The goal was to reinforce lecture content by rewriting and testing concepts like control flow, loops, pointers, and simple I/O.

name: C-Plus-Plus-Exercises
title: C Plus Plus Exercises
description: This repository contains a variety of small C++ projects and programming exercises I completed outside of formal coursework. Many of these were inspired by coding books, self-imposed challenges, or online programming tasks I encountered during my first and second year of university.

name: Beginning-C-Plus-Plus-Through-Game-Programming
title: Beginning C Plus Plus Through Game Programming
description: Following the book "Beginning C++ Game Programming" with various projects including Pong and Timber.

name: Objects-And-Types-Miles-To-Km
title: Objects And Types Miles To Km
description: This is a beginner-level C++ project built during my early university studies. It was created to practice using objects, primitive types, and basic user input/output in C++. The project implements a simple miles-to-kilometers converter, using clean code and structured output.

name: University-Year-1
title: University Year 1
description: Work completed in my first year attending the University of Suffolk (2021-2022)

name: University-Year-3
title: University Year 3
description: Work completed in my third year attending the University of Suffolk (2023-2024)

name: Richard-Casey
title: Richard Casey
description: A special README file used for GitHub profiles.

name: University-Year-2
title: University Year 2
description: Work completed in my second year attending the University of Suffolk (2022-2023)

name: The-Other-Half-Hub-Website
title: The Other Half Hub Website
description: A responsive, content-rich frontend web application built in React with TailwindCSS. Designed to support parents, fathers, and wellbeing coordinators by providing access to national and local support groups, media resources, and digital wellbeing tools.

name: Pet-System
title: Pet System
description: Pet System in C# A simple demo of Interfaces, Abstract Classes, and Polymorphism using pets.

name: Chuck-Norris-Fact-Demo
title: Chuck Norris Fact Demo
description: A C# console demo that uses async/await to fetch and display a random Chuck Norris joke from the internet.

name: Stock-and-Shop
title: Stock and Shop
description: Stock and Shop is a modular, simulation-style retail management game developed in Unity as part of my final-year dissertation project. It was awarded a First Class (73%) and was the department’s official nominee for the 2024 TIGA Awards.

name: Richard-Casey.co.uk
title: Richard Casey.co.uk
description: My personal website Richard-Casey.co.uk - That might even be where your reading this right now!
